abstract: CBS won the network television ratings race on Thursday thanks to a rerun of “CSI” and “Big Brother.”
snippet: CBS won the network television ratings race on Thursday thanks to a rerun of “CSI” and “Big Brother.”
lead_paragraph: CBS won the network television ratings race on Thursday thanks to a rerun of “CSI” and “Big Brother.” According to Nielsen’s estimates, “Big Brother” led during the 8 p.m. hour, drawing 6.5 million viewers, which was slightly above average for the season. At 9 p.m., CBS’s “CSI” earned 7.9 million, just trailing behind Fox’s results episode of “So You Think You Can Dance” (8.5 million).
